  <meta content="The Writers’ Trust of Canada is a charitable organization that seeks to advance, nurture, and celebrate Canadian writers and writing. Writers’ Trust programming is designed to champion excellence in Canadian writing, to improve the status of writers, and to create connections between writers and readers.

Writers’ Trust programs include:

Ten prestigious national literary awards that reward excellence at all career stages and across genres
A scholarship program to advance emerging writers
Canada’s most sought-after writers’ retreat, in Dawson City, Yukon
A literary events program to connect writers and readers
The Woodcock Fund, a one-of-a-kind emergency grant program that has given more than one million dollars to writers in financial crisis

The Writers’ Trust was founded in 1976 by five notable and visionary Canadian authors — Margaret Atwood, Pierre Berton, Graeme Gibson, Margaret Laurence, and David Young — to encourage a flourishing writing community in Canada. The Writers’ Trust is proud to continue their work to keep writers writing, to celebrate their achievements, and to enable them to stand at the forefront of Canadian culture.

Mission
To advance, nurture, and celebrate Canadian writers and writing.

Vision
To champion excellence in Canadian writing, to improve the status of writers in this country, and to create connections between writers and readers." name="description"/>

                        Quotes

          <div class="contentQuote clear">
           <img alt="Margaret Atwood" height="71" src="/WritersTrust/images/imgMargaretAtwood.jpg" title="Margaret Atwood" width="61"/>
           <q>
            “Your donation to the Writers' Trust could be the difference between a finished book and one whose pages remain blank forever.”
           </q>
           <cite title="Margaret Atwood - Founder, The Writers' Trust of Canada">
            Margaret Atwood
            <span>
             Co-Founder, The Writers' Trust of Canada
            </span>
           </cite>
          </div>
          <!-- /.contentQuote -->
          <div class="contentQuote clear last">
           <img alt="Lawrence Hill" src="/getattachment/Home/Hill_Lawrence.jpg.aspx" style="width: 61px; height: 71px;" title="LawrenceHill"/>
           <q>
            “The Writers' Trust is a pillar of the Canadian writing community, providing vital programs for writers at every stage of their careers.”
           </q>
           <cite title="Lawrence Hill - Winner, 2007 Rogers Writers' Trust Fiction Prize">
            Lawrence Hill Winner, 2007 Rogers Writers' Trust Fiction Prize
           </cite>
          </div>
          <!-- /.contentQuote -->
          <hr class="hiddenBreak"/>
          <!--
                        Featured Profile
                        -->
          <div class="clear pngFix" id="contentProfile">
           <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iHdE42k6G_U&amp;feature=c4-overview&amp;list=UUfMp3b42nFsrsxpTQLQ-lWw" target="_blank">
            <img alt="Shaughnessy Cohen" src="https://www.writerstrust.com/getmedia/4b3fa46e-5e9b-4844-a16c-322e267326d3/munro-thumb.aspx" style="width: 61px; height: 71px;" title="Shaughnessy Cohen"/>
           </a>
           <p>
            The Writers’ Trust would like to extend our heartfelt congratulations to short fiction genius Alice Munro, winner of the 2013 Nobel Prize in Literature.
            <a href="http://bit.ly/17zD2nY" target="_blank">
             Watch our video tribute
            </a>
            featuring authors Miriam Toews, Douglas Gibson, Alistair MacLeod, and more.
           </p>
          </div>
